\subsubsection{app.migrations package}
\label{\detokenize{app.migrations:app-migrations-package}}\label{\detokenize{app.migrations::doc}}

\paragraph{Submodules}

\paragraph{app.migrations.0001\_initial module}
\label{\detokenize{app.migrations:module-app.migrations.0001_initial}}\label{\detokenize{app.migrations:app-migrations-0001-initial-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!app.migrations.0001\_initial@\spxentry{app.migrations.0001\_initial}}\index{app.migrations.0001\_initial@\spxentry{app.migrations.0001\_initial}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{Migration (class in app.migrations.0001\_initial)@\spxentry{Migration}\spxextra{class in app.migrations.0001\_initial}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{app.migrations:app.migrations.0001_initial.Migration}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{app.migrations.0001\_initial.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Migration}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{name}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{app\_label}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Migration}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This migration script initializes the database schema for the application. 
It creates tables and relationships for various models including boards, 
connectors, folders, interfaces, I/O types, links, resource names, contacts, 
files, and associations.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Models and Fields:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
boards: Represents a board with a primary key field \sphinxtitleref{board}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
connecteur: Represents a connector with fields \sphinxtitleref{dimension\_row} and \sphinxtitleref{dimension\_column}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
connector: Represents a connector with fields \sphinxtitleref{name}, \sphinxtitleref{row\_dim}, and \sphinxtitleref{column\_dim}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Folder: Represents a folder with a field \sphinxtitleref{folder\_name}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
interfaces: Represents an interface with a primary key field \sphinxtitleref{interface}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
io\_type: Represents an I/O type with fields \sphinxtitleref{io\_type\_name} and \sphinxtitleref{io\_type\_symbol}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
link: Represents a link with fields \sphinxtitleref{first\_interface}, \sphinxtitleref{second\_interface}, and \sphinxtitleref{nom\_link}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
resource\_name: Represents a resource name with a primary key field \sphinxtitleref{name}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
contacts: Represents a contact with fields \sphinxtitleref{signal\_name}, \sphinxtitleref{num\_row}, \sphinxtitleref{num\_column}, and a foreign key to \sphinxtitleref{connecteur}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
File: Represents a file with fields \sphinxtitleref{file\_name}, \sphinxtitleref{data}, and a foreign key to \sphinxtitleref{Folder}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
interfaceConnector: Represents a connection between an interface and a connector with foreign keys to \sphinxtitleref{interfaces} and \sphinxtitleref{connector}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
connecteur: Adds a foreign key to \sphinxtitleref{interfaces}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
association: Represents an association with fields \sphinxtitleref{nombre\_resource} and foreign keys to \sphinxtitleref{interfaces} and \sphinxtitleref{resource\_name}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
IO\_list: Represents an I/O list with fields \sphinxtitleref{resource\_name}, \sphinxtitleref{signal\_name}, \sphinxtitleref{nature}, \sphinxtitleref{from\_to}, \sphinxtitleref{source\_destination\_board}, \sphinxtitleref{description}, \sphinxtitleref{connector}, and a foreign key to \sphinxtitleref{association}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
resources\_categories: Represents resource categories with fields \sphinxtitleref{category}, \sphinxtitleref{count}, and a many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}many relationship to \sphinxtitleref{io\_type}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
modele\_io\_mapping: Represents a mapping of I/O models with fields \sphinxtitleref{modele\_name}, and many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}many relationships to \sphinxtitleref{interfaces}, \sphinxtitleref{io\_type}, \sphinxtitleref{link}, \sphinxtitleref{resource\_name}, and \sphinxtitleref{resources\_categories}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
assigned\_resources: Represents assigned resources with fields \sphinxtitleref{signal\_name}, \sphinxtitleref{board\_internal\_mapping}, \sphinxtitleref{commentaire}, \sphinxtitleref{io\_index}, and foreign keys to \sphinxtitleref{io\_type} and \sphinxtitleref{resources\_categories}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
wirings: Represents wirings with fields \sphinxtitleref{first\_signal}, \sphinxtitleref{second\_signal}, and a foreign key to \sphinxtitleref{link}.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Dependencies:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This migration has no dependencies.

\sphinxlineitem{Operations:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
migrations.CreateModel: Creates each model and its fields as described above.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Commands to Generate and Apply Migration:}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Generate the migration script:
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciigrave{}bash
python manage.py makemigrations app
\textasciigrave{}}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Apply the migration to update the database schema:
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciigrave{}bash
python manage.py migrate
\textasciigrave{}}}

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxlineitem{Possible Errors:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
ImportError: If Django is not installed or not available on the PYTHONPATH.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
OperationalError: If there is an issue with the database connection or schema.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
FieldError: If there are issues with field definitions, such as invalid field types or relationships.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
ProgrammingError: If there are issues with the SQL commands generated by the migration.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
IntegrityError: If there are issues with data integrity, such as violating unique constraints.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{on\_delete} parameter in foreign keys is used to handle deletion behavior, such as \sphinxtitleref{CASCADE} or \sphinxtitleref{SET\_NULL}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{related\_name} parameter in foreign keys and many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}many fields is used to specify the name of the reverse relation from the target model back to this one.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\paragraph{Module contents}
\label{\detokenize{app.migrations:module-app.migrations}}\label{\detokenize{app.migrations:module-contents}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!app.migrations@\spxentry{app.migrations}}\index{app.migrations@\spxentry{app.migrations}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\subsection{Submodules}
\label{\detokenize{app:submodules}}

\subsection{app.admin module}
\label{\detokenize{app:module-app.admin}}\label{\detokenize{app:app-admin-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!app.admin@\spxentry{app.admin}}\index{app.admin@\spxentry{app.admin}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module configures the Django admin interface for the application. It imports and registers various models with the Django admin to enable CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations via the admin panel. Each model registration enhances the admin interface by allowing administrators to manage database records for the application directly through a web interface.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Usage:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module is automatically used by Django’s admin app to determine which models are available in the admin interface and how they are displayed. No further steps are required beyond importing this module in your admin.py file.

\sphinxlineitem{Modifications:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
You can customize the behavior of models in the admin by creating ModelAdmin classes and registering them with their respective models. See Django’s documentation on ModelAdmin for more details: \sphinxurl{https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/stable/ref/contrib/admin/\#django.contrib.admin.ModelAdmin}

\sphinxlineitem{Models Registered:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Folder: Represents a folder in a file system (potentially virtual).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
File: Represents a file contained within a Folder.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
resources\_categories: Categorizes various resources, potentially linking to io\_types.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
io\_type: Defines types of I/O operations or resources.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
assigned\_resources: Links resources to specific tasks or uses in the system.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
resource\_name: Names a particular resource, giving it a unique identifier.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
association: Represents a many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}many relationship between resources and other elements in the system.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
connecteur: Represents a physical or logical connector within the system.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
interfaces: Defines various interfaces available within the system.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
IO\_list: Lists I/O operations or tasks.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
contacts: Represents contact points or nodes in connecteurs.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
link: Represents a link or connection between two interfaces.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
wirings: Details the wiring configurations used within the system.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
modele\_io\_mapping: Maps I/O models to various components or configurations within the system.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Examples:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To add a model to the admin interface, simply import the model and use the \sphinxtitleref{admin.site.register()} function:
{\color{red}\bfseries{}\textasciigrave{}\textasciigrave{}}{\color{red}\bfseries{}\textasciigrave{}}python
from django.contrib import admin
from .models import MyModel

\sphinxAtStartPar
admin.site.register(MyModel)
{\color{red}\bfseries{}\textasciigrave{}\textasciigrave{}}{\color{red}\bfseries{}\textasciigrave{}}

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure that each model has a unique representation in the admin; otherwise, it can be confusing to differentiate between similar records.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Use \sphinxtitleref{list\_display}, \sphinxtitleref{search\_fields}, and other \sphinxtitleref{ModelAdmin} options to enhance admin interface usability.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Warnings:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Improper configuration of the admin can lead to security risks, e.g., exposing sensitive data or allowing unintended operations. Always restrict admin access using appropriate permissions.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\subsection{app.apps module}
\label{\detokenize{app:module-app.apps}}\label{\detokenize{app:app-apps-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!app.apps@\spxentry{app.apps}}\index{app.apps@\spxentry{app.apps}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{AppConfig (class in app.apps)@\spxentry{AppConfig}\spxextra{class in app.apps}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{app:app.apps.AppConfig}}
\pysigstartsignatures

\index{ready() (app.apps.AppConfig method)@\spxentry{ready()}\spxextra{app.apps.AppConfig method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{app:app.apps.AppConfig.ready}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ready}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
This method is called when the application is ready. It imports the
signal handlers defined in the ‘app.signals’ module.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Usage:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This method is automatically called by Django when the application is
initialized. No direct call to this method is necessary.

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure that the ‘app.signals’ module exists and contains the necessary
signal handlers. Improper configuration or missing signal handlers can
lead to application errors.

\sphinxlineitem{Examples:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To define a signal handler, create a ‘signals.py’ file in your ‘app’
directory and define your signals as follows:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{django}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{db}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{models}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{signals} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{post\PYGZus{}save}
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{django}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{dispatch} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{receiver}
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{models} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{MyModel}

\PYG{n+nd}{@receiver}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{post\PYGZus{}save}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{sender}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{MyModel}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{my\PYGZus{}signal\PYGZus{}handler}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{sender}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{instance}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{created}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{*}\PYG{o}{*}\PYG{n}{kwargs}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{created}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Handle the signal}
        \PYG{k}{pass}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This signal handler will be imported and connected when the application
is ready.

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{app.manage module}
\label{\detokenize{app:module-app.manage}}\label{\detokenize{app:app-manage-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!app.manage@\spxentry{app.manage}}\index{app.manage@\spxentry{app.manage}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Django’s command\sphinxhyphen{}line utility for administrative tasks.
\index{main() (in module app.manage)@\spxentry{main()}\spxextra{in module app.manage}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{app:app.manage.main}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{app.manage.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{main}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Run administrative tasks.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This function sets the \sphinxtitleref{DJANGO\_SETTINGS\_MODULE} environment variable to specify the 
settings module for the Django project. It then attempts to import and execute Django’s 
command\sphinxhyphen{}line utility for administrative tasks.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Environment Variables:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
DJANGO\_SETTINGS\_MODULE (str): Specifies the settings module to be used by Django. 
It is set to ‘mapping.settings’ by default.

\sphinxlineitem{Exceptions:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
ImportError: Raised if Django is not installed or not available on the 
PYTHONPATH environment variable.

\sphinxlineitem{Examples:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To execute a Django management command, run this script from the command line:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYGZdl{}\PYG{+w}{ }python3\PYG{+w}{ }./manage.py\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZlt{}command\PYGZgt{}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Replace \sphinxtitleref{\textless{}command\textgreater{}} with the desired administrative command, such as \sphinxtitleref{runserver} 
or \sphinxtitleref{migrate}.

\sphinxlineitem{Raises:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
ImportError: If Django is not installed or the \sphinxtitleref{DJANGO\_SETTINGS\_MODULE} is not set 
correctly.

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
This function is typically called automatically when the script is executed directly.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It ensures that the Django environment is properly set up before running 
administrative tasks.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{connected (app.models.interfaces attribute)@\spxentry{connected}\spxextra{app.models.interfaces attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{app:app.models.interfaces.connected}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{connected}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a
many\sphinxhyphen{}to\sphinxhyphen{}one relation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
In the example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{Child}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Model}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{parent} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ForeignKey}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{Parent}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{related\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{children}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Parent.children}} is a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ReverseManyToOneDescriptor}} instance.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager
class built by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_forward\_many\_to\_many\_manager()}} defined below.

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{description}

\subsection{app.signals module}
\label{\detokenize{app:module-app.signals}}\label{\detokenize{app:app-signals-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!app.signals@\spxentry{app.signals}}\index{app.signals@\spxentry{app.signals}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{create\_assigned\_resources() (in module app.signals)@\spxentry{create\_assigned\_resources()}\spxextra{in module app.signals}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{app:app.signals.create_assigned_resources}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{app.signals.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_assigned\_resources}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{sender}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{instance}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{created}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Signal receiver that creates or updates assigned resources when a resources\_categories instance is saved.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This function is triggered after a resources\_categories instance is saved. It handles 
both the creation of new assigned resources when a new category is created and the 
update of existing assigned resources when a category’s count is modified.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
sender (Model): The model class that sent the signal.
instance (resources\_categories): The instance of the model that was saved.
created (bool): A boolean indicating whether a new record was created.
{\color{red}\bfseries{}**}kwargs: Additional keyword arguments.

\sphinxlineitem{Examples:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
When a new resources\_categories instance is created:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{category} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{resources\PYGZus{}categories}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{objects}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{create}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{category}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{NewCategory}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{count}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} This will automatically create 5 assigned\PYGZus{}resources instances for the new category.}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
When an existing resources\_categories instance is updated:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{category} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{resources\PYGZus{}categories}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{objects}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{category}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{NewCategory}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{category}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{count} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{10}
\PYG{n}{category}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{save}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} This will automatically update the assigned\PYGZus{}resources instances to match the new count.}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{create\_assigned\_resources} function uses Django’s \sphinxtitleref{post\_save} signal to automatically 
manage the creation and updating of \sphinxtitleref{assigned\_resources} instances. This ensures that the 
number of \sphinxtitleref{assigned\_resources} matches the \sphinxtitleref{count} attribute of the \sphinxtitleref{resources\_categories} 
instance.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
If the \sphinxtitleref{resources\_categories} instance is newly created, the function creates the specified 
number of \sphinxtitleref{assigned\_resources} instances.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
If the \sphinxtitleref{resources\_categories} instance is updated, the function checks whether the number of 
existing \sphinxtitleref{assigned\_resources} instances matches the \sphinxtitleref{count} attribute. If not, it deletes the 
existing instances and creates new ones to match the updated count.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
This automation helps maintain data consistency and integrity by ensuring that the number of 
\sphinxtitleref{assigned\_resources} is always in sync with the \sphinxtitleref{count} attribute of the \sphinxtitleref{resources\_categories} 
instance.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subsection{app.urls module}
\label{\detokenize{app:module-app.urls}}\label{\detokenize{app:app-urls-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!app.urls@\spxentry{app.urls}}\index{app.urls@\spxentry{app.urls}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
URL Configuration for the Application.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This module defines the URL patterns for the application. Each URL pattern is associated 
with a specific view function that handles the corresponding HTTP request. The URLs cover 
various functionalities including retrieving data, updating resources, and managing associations.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Usage:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
These URL patterns are automatically used by Django to route HTTP requests to the appropriate 
view functions. Each pattern is mapped to a specific endpoint and a view function.

\sphinxlineitem{Examples:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To add a new URL pattern, import the view function and add a path entry to the urlpatterns list:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{.} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{views}
\PYG{n}{urlpatterns}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{path}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{new\PYGZus{}endpoint/}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{views}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{new\PYGZus{}view}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{name}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{new\PYGZus{}view}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxlineitem{Attributes:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
urlpatterns (list): A list of URL patterns to be matched against incoming requests.

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure that the view functions referenced in the URL patterns are defined in the views module.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
URL patterns can include parameters to capture parts of the URL and pass them to the view function.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Add an association between an interface and a resource type based on the provided data.

\sphinxAtStartPar

and a resource type and returns a JSON response indicating success.

\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}

\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {}

\index{associate\_connecteur() (in module app.views)@\spxentry{associate\_connecteur()}\spxextra{in module app.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{app.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{associate\_connecteur}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Associate a connector (connecteur) with an interface based on the provided data.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This view function handles the creation of a \sphinxtitleref{connecteur} object and associates it 
with an \sphinxtitleref{interfaces} object. It processes the incoming JSON data to create the connector 
and returns a JSON response indicating success or failure.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object containing the JSON data.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
JsonResponse: A JSON response indicating the success or failure of the operation.

\sphinxlineitem{Examples:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Example JSON request body for associating a connecteur:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}interface\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Interface1\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}row\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}column\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Example JSON response on success:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}success\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{err}{T}\PYG{err}{r}\PYG{err}{u}\PYG{err}{e}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}message\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Successfully associated an interface with a connecteur.\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The function uses \sphinxtitleref{json.loads} to parse the incoming JSON data.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It checks for the presence of required fields in the received data.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It retrieves the \sphinxtitleref{interfaces} object by the provided interface name.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\PYG{+w}{    }\PYG{n+nt}{\PYGZdq{}message\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}Resource category deleted successfully\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The function uses \sphinxtitleref{json.loads} to parse the incoming JSON data.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It fetches the \sphinxtitleref{resources\_categories} object by the provided category name.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{delete} method is called on the fetched object, which will cascade and 
delete related entries if the ForeignKey is set with \sphinxtitleref{on\_delete=models.CASCADE}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
On error, it returns a JSON response with the error message and a 500 status code.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Retrieve the I/O types associated with a given resource.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This function fetches all \sphinxtitleref{io\_type} objects associated with the provided 
resource, formats them into a list of their names, and returns the list.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
resource (resources\_categories): The resource category for which to retrieve associated I/O types.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
list: A list of I/O type names associated with the provided resource.

\sphinxlineitem{Examples:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Assuming \sphinxtitleref{resource} is an instance of \sphinxtitleref{resources\_categories}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{resource} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{resources\PYGZus{}categories}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{objects}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{get}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{category}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Resource1}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{io\PYGZus{}types} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{get\PYGZus{}io\PYGZus{}res}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{resource}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{io\PYGZus{}types}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Output: [\PYGZsq{}IOType1\PYGZsq{}, \PYGZsq{}IOType2\PYGZsq{}]}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The function uses a reverse relationship lookup to find \sphinxtitleref{io\_type} objects associated with the given resource.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
The returned list contains only the names of the I/O types.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\index{home() (in module app.views)@\spxentry{home()}\spxextra{in module app.views}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{app:app.views.home}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{app.views.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{home}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{request}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Handle requests to the home page.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This view function processes both GET and POST requests to the home page. It handles 
the creation of folders and files based on the submitted form data and retrieves all 
folders, I/O types, and resource categories to be displayed on the page.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
request (HttpRequest): The HTTP request object.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
HttpResponse: The HTTP response object with the rendered home page.

\sphinxlineitem{POST Handling:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
If the request method is POST, it checks the form\_name to determine the type of form submitted.

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{For ‘file\_form’:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Retrieves or creates the specified folder.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Processes the uploaded files and saves them to the folder.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{For ‘folder\_form’:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Retrieves the folder name from the request.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Checks if a folder with the same name already exists.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Creates a new folder if it doesn’t exist or handles the case where it already exists.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Redirects to the home page to avoid form resubmission on page refresh.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Examples:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} \begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Submitting a ‘file\_form’ with selected files:}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{form\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{file\PYGZus{}form}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{selected\PYGZhy{}folder}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Documents}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{files}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{n}{file1}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{n}{file2}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{p}{]}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\PYG{n}{response} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{client}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{post}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{/}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}\begin{itemize}

\item {}

\section{generate\_documentation package}
\label{\detokenize{generate_documentation:generate-documentation-package}}\label{\detokenize{generate_documentation::doc}}

\subsection{Submodules}
\label{\detokenize{generate_documentation:submodules}}

\subsection{generate\_documentation.adjust\_paths\_rst module}
\label{\detokenize{generate_documentation:module-generate_documentation.adjust_paths_rst}}\label{\detokenize{generate_documentation:generate-documentation-adjust-paths-rst-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!generate\_documentation.adjust\_paths\_rst@\spxentry{generate\_documentation.adjust\_paths\_rst}}\index{generate\_documentation.adjust\_paths\_rst@\spxentry{generate\_documentation.adjust\_paths\_rst}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This script corrects the module paths in the \sphinxtitleref{modules.rst} file generated by Sphinx.

\sphinxAtStartPar
It ensures that all module paths in the \sphinxtitleref{modules.rst} file are prefixed with the project root 
module name (\sphinxtitleref{MS\sphinxhyphen{}CHARAC\sphinxhyphen{}BACK.}). This is necessary for Sphinx to correctly locate and document 
the modules within the project.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The script performs the following steps:
1. Reads the content of the \sphinxtitleref{modules.rst} file.
2. Checks each line for the \sphinxtitleref{.. automodule::} directive.
3. Adds the project root prefix (\sphinxtitleref{MS\sphinxhyphen{}CHARAC\sphinxhyphen{}BACK.}) to the module name if it is not already present.
4. Writes the corrected content back to the \sphinxtitleref{modules.rst} file.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Usage:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Simply run the script in an environment where the \sphinxtitleref{BASE\_DIR} environment variable is set 
to the root directory of your project.

\sphinxlineitem{Examples:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Assuming the \sphinxtitleref{BASE\_DIR} environment variable is set, run the script as follows:

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciigrave{}python
python correct\_modules\_rst.py
\textasciigrave{}}}

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure that the \sphinxtitleref{BASE\_DIR} environment variable is correctly set to the root directory 
of your project before running this script.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
This script assumes that the \sphinxtitleref{modules.rst} file is located in the \sphinxtitleref{docs} directory 
under the project root.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Possible Errors:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
FileNotFoundError: If the \sphinxtitleref{modules.rst} file is not found at the specified path.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
IOError: If there are issues with reading from or writing to the \sphinxtitleref{modules.rst} file.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}


\subsection{generate\_documentation.modify\_conf module}
\label{\detokenize{generate_documentation:module-generate_documentation.modify_conf}}\label{\detokenize{generate_documentation:generate-documentation-modify-conf-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!generate\_documentation.modify\_conf@\spxentry{generate\_documentation.modify\_conf}}\index{generate\_documentation.modify\_conf@\spxentry{generate\_documentation.modify\_conf}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This script modifies the Sphinx \sphinxtitleref{conf.py} and \sphinxtitleref{index.rst} files to correctly 
configure the documentation build process for a Django project.

\sphinxAtStartPar
It ensures that:
1. The necessary paths and settings for Django are added.
2. Required Sphinx extensions are included.
3. Unnecessary TODO settings are removed.
4. The HTML theme is updated.
5. The \sphinxtitleref{modules} directive is added to \sphinxtitleref{index.rst} for module documentation.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Steps Performed:}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read and modify \sphinxtitleref{conf.py} to:
\sphinxhyphen{} Add the Django setup and \sphinxtitleref{sys.path} modifications.
\sphinxhyphen{} Ensure necessary Sphinx extensions are included.
\sphinxhyphen{} Update \sphinxtitleref{exclude\_patterns} to exclude build artifacts.
\sphinxhyphen{} Change the HTML theme to \sphinxtitleref{sphinx\_rtd\_theme}.
\sphinxhyphen{} Remove \sphinxtitleref{todo\_include\_todos} if present.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read and modify \sphinxtitleref{index.rst} to:
\sphinxhyphen{} Add the \sphinxtitleref{modules} directive under the \sphinxtitleref{:caption: Contents:} section.

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxlineitem{Usage:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Simply run the script in an environment where the \sphinxtitleref{BASE\_DIR} environment variable 
is set to the root directory of your project.

\sphinxlineitem{Examples:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Assuming the \sphinxtitleref{BASE\_DIR} environment variable is set, run the script as follows:

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textasciigrave{}python
python modify\_sphinx\_files.py
\textasciigrave{}}}

\sphinxlineitem{Possible Errors:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
FileNotFoundError: If the \sphinxtitleref{conf.py} or \sphinxtitleref{index.rst} file is not found at the specified path.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
IOError: If there are issues with reading from or writing to the \sphinxtitleref{conf.py} or \sphinxtitleref{index.rst} file.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Notes:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure that the \sphinxtitleref{BASE\_DIR} environment variable is correctly set to the root directory 
of your project before running this script.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
This script assumes that the \sphinxtitleref{conf.py} and \sphinxtitleref{index.rst} files are located in the \sphinxtitleref{docs} directory 
under the project root.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
It also ensures a brief wait time using \sphinxtitleref{time.sleep(2)} after making modifications.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\section{mapping package}

mapping URL Configuration
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{The \sphinxtitleref{urlpatterns} list routes URLs to views. For more information please see:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxurl{https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.2/topics/http/urls/}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Examples:
Function views
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add an import:  from my\_app import views

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add a URL to urlpatterns:  path(‘’, views.home, name=’home’)

\end{enumerate}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Class\sphinxhyphen{}based views}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add an import:  from other\_app.views import Home

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add a URL to urlpatterns:  path(‘’, Home.as\_view(), name=’home’)

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxlineitem{Including another URLconf}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Import the include() function: from django.urls import include, path

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add a URL to urlpatterns:  path(‘blog/’, include(‘blog.urls’))

\end{enumerate}

\end{description}
